mappings.name: parent
mappings.desc: (Term id) Parent term to create a group

terms.name: Rated Capacity Limiter System
terms.description: A system monitoring load weight, boom angle, and crane configuration to prevent overloading by alerting and restricting crane movement when capacity limits are approached or exceeded.
terms.additionalInformation: overloadAlarmThreshold: 100% rated capacity, maintenanceIntervalCheck: 750 working hours

terms.name: Engine
terms.description: The prime mover in the crane’s upper structure that converts fuel into mechanical energy for powering all crane functions.

terms.id: HSL Crawler Crane Link-Belt Cranes 248 HSL
terms.name: HSL Crawler Crane 248
Hydraulic System
terms.description: The collection of pumps, motors, valves, hoses, and reservoirs that provide hydraulic power to the crane’s hoist, boom, swing, and travel functions.

terms.name: Hydraulic Pumps
terms.description: Variable and fixed displacement pumps that supply hydraulic flow to different crane functions, operating at specific pressures and flow rates.

terms.name: Load Hoist Drums
terms.description: Cylindrical drums driven by hydraulic motors, used for lifting and lowering the load line through wire rope winding.

terms.name: Boom Hoist Drum
terms.description: A specialized drum used to raise and lower the crane’s boom via hydraulic power, enabling angle adjustments.

terms.name: Swing System
terms.description: A mechanism consisting of hydraulic motors and gear reduction that allows the crane’s upper structure to rotate (swing) 360° around the turntable bearing.

terms.name: Counterweight
terms.description: Removable weights installed on the upper structure to balance and stabilize loads, especially when working at greater radii.

terms.name: Operator Cab
terms.description: An enclosed module housing the crane controls, instrumentation, seating, and climate control for the operator.

terms.name: Carbody
terms.description: The central frame of the lower structure providing the main support and connection points for the side frames and jacking system.

terms.name: Side Frames
terms.description: Steel frames mounted on the carbody, housing tracks and rollers, providing lateral stability and mobility.
terms.additionalInformation: maxTrackGauge: 5.74 m, maintenanceIntervalCheck: 2000 working hours, maintenanceAfterTravel: 200 km

terms.name: Conventional Tube Boom
terms.description: The main lattice boom structure made of tubular chord sections that can be extended using extensions for increased reach and capacity configurations.

terms.name: Tubular Jib
terms.description: A separate lattice attachment that can be added to the main tube boom to extend reach or allow different lifting angles.

terms.name: Luffing Jib
terms.description: An optional attachment mounted to a luffing boom, providing extended reach and additional lift configurations; pivots independently for complex lifting tasks.

terms.name: Luffing Boom
terms.description: A boom configuration featuring pivot points and pendants allowing a higher operating angle range, typically used with a luffing jib for heavy and high lifts.

terms.name: Fuel Tank
terms.description: The reservoir storing diesel fuel for the engine, equipped with a sight gauge for fuel level.

relations.target: HSL Crawler Crane Link-Belt Cranes 248 HSL
relations.name: ComponentOf
DependsOn
relations.description: The Luffing Jib’s pivot and lift capabilities depend on the Luffing Boom; if the Luffing Boom is serviced, the Jib must be checked.

relations.target: HSL Crawler Crane Link-Belt Cranes 248 HSL
relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Engine is part of (a component of) the overall crane.

relations.target: HSL Crawler Crane Link-Belt Cranes 248 HSL
relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Hydraulic System is a core subsystem of the crane.

relations.target: HSL Crawler Crane Link-Belt Cranes 248 HSL
relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Lower Structure (carbody, side frames) is part of the crane’s base.

relations.target: HSL Crawler Crane Link-Belt Cranes 248 HSL
relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Upper Structure (including engine, cab, counterweights) is part of the crane.

relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: Hydraulic Pumps supply the Hydraulic System with fluid power.

relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: Load Hoist Drums are powered by, and thus form part of, the Hydraulic System.

relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Boom Hoist Drum is a subcomponent of the Hydraulic System, enabling boom angle adjustments.

relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Swing System’s motors and gears rely on the hydraulic power source; it is part of the Hydraulic System.

relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Counterweight is mounted on the Upper Structure, providing balance.

relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Operator Cab is housed on the Upper Structure.

relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Carbody (central frame) is part of the Lower Structure.

relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: Side Frames attach to the Carbody for stability and mounting of tracks.

relations.target: HSL Crawler Crane Link-Belt Cranes 248 HSL
relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Conventional Tube Boom is a primary lifting attachment of the crane.

relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Tubular Jib extends/attaches to the Tube Boom for added reach or lift angles.

relations.name: ComponentOf
relations.description: The Luffing Jib attaches to the Luffing Boom for additional hoisting configurations.

relations.name: DependsOn
relations.description: The Engine requires a fuel supply; if the Fuel Tank is serviced or replaced, the Engine should also be checked.

relations.name: DependsOn
relations.description: The Hydraulic System is powered by the Engine; significant Engine maintenance may require re-checking hydraulic components.

relations.name: DependsOn
relations.description: Load Hoist Drums rely on hydraulic power; a Hydraulic System service calls for inspection of Hoist Drums.

relations.name: DependsOn
relations.description: The Boom Hoist Drum depends on hydraulic function; if Hydraulic System is repaired, Boom Hoist Drum operation must be verified.

relations.name: DependsOn
relations.description: The Swing System depends on hydraulic flow; servicing the Hydraulic System requires testing Swing System performance.

relations.name: DependsOn
relations.description: Counterweight removal and installation rely on jacks; if the Jack System is serviced, Counterweight functionality should be inspected.

relations.target: HSL Crawler Crane Link-Belt Cranes 248 HSL
relations.name: ComponentOf
